metadata.title: CVE-2018-2583 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:Stored Procedure). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.38 andprior and 5.7.20 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows highprivileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Server. While the vulnerability is in MySQL Server,attacks may significantly impact additional products. Successful attacks ofthis vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a hang orfrequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.0 BaseScore 6.8 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-2583` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.21-1ubuntu1
mysql-client - 5.7.21-1ubuntu1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.21-1ubuntu1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.21-1ubuntu1
mysql-server - 5.7.21-1ubuntu1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.21-1ubuntu1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.21-1ubuntu1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.21-1ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.21-1ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.21-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.21-1ubuntu1').
